post_text:
Dear Parents/Guardians,

Due to a recent announcement from the U.S Department of Agriculture (USDA), the District can provide free lunch meals to all children until December 2020. Starting immediately no student meal account will be charged for lunch. Free meals are available to any child under the age of 18 and the child does not need to be enrolled in the District.

Starting Tuesday, September 8th, the District will also provide meals for the weekend, adding one more distribution on Friday.

Please visit the District Website/Food Service https://www.district41.org/domain/167 for more information when and where the meals can be picked up.

Lake Villa School District #41

post_text: The Lake Villa Board of Education approved Tentative Budget for FY2020-2021 at its Regular Board Meeting on August 17, 2020. The tentative budget is available for public inspection at the District Office 131 McKinley Ave, Lake Villa 60041 during office hours 8:30am-4:00pm or by visiting the District Website. The Final Budget will be presented for approval on September 28, 2020 following the Public Hearing at 7:00pm.

post_text: Hello, This is an announcement to let you know that Lake Villa School District 41 will be moving to a new mass communication system via Blackboard starting on July 1st. The new system offers greater flexibility and integration than our current SwiftK12 system as well as integrates directly into our website and mobile app for greater coverage. There is nothing you need to do at this time other than be on the look out for messages from blackboard.com after July 1st.

post_text:
Dear Parents and Guardians,
We are so sorry, but in light of the recent social unrest and threats in Lake County, we have been in contact with our local police departments. We are very sad to inform you that all parades today for Lake Villa schools are cancelled. This breaks our hearts as much as yours. We are committed to keeping everyone safe during these turbulent times and we need to keep our own first responders able to do their jobs.

We are rescheduling our elementary parades to 11:30 a.m. and middle school to 12:30 p.m. on June 10th. We understand our children and staff need closure. We all want you to know we are in this together.

Dr. Lynette Zimmer
Superintendent
text:
Dear Parents and Guardians,
We are so sorry, but in light of the recent social unrest and threats in Lake County, we have been in contact with our local police departments. We are very sad to inform you that all parades today for Lake Villa schools are cancelled. This breaks our hearts as much as yours. We are committed to keeping everyone safe during these turbulent times and we need to keep our own first responders able to do their jobs.

We are rescheduling our elementary parades to 11:30 a.m. and middle school to 12:30 p.m. on June 10th. We understand our children and staff need closure. We all want you to know we are in this together.

Dr. Lynette Zimmer
Superintendent

post_text: Reminder: Report cards will be available for all eighth grade students on Thursday, May 28th and Kindergarten through seventh grade on Monday, June 1st. Due to the closing of on-site learning due to COVID 19 and guidelines provided to school districts by the State of Illinois, Lake Villa School District will not be providing achievement or standards grades for the third trimester. Instead, teaching staff will be providing students and parents comments on student engagement for remote learning.

post_text:
Board of Education meeting Monday, April 20, 2020.
Per Gov. Prizker's Disaster Proclamation effective March 9, 2020 through the end of the 2019-2020 school year, the Governor has suspended the requirement that a quorum of the members of a public body be physically present at a board meeting and the conditions which limit when remote participation is permitted.

Public bodies are encouraged to "provide videa, audio, and/or telephone access to meetings to ensure that the public may monitor the meeting." To that end, the Lake Villa School District #41 Board of Education meetings held during the duration of the disaster proclamation related to COVID-19, will be available to the community by visiting the website https://www.district41.org/domain/294 4/20/2020. Persons interested in making a statement during the Public Comments portion of the meeting may do so by sending an email to comments@district41.org to be read aloud during the designated point of the meeting.

post_text:
UPDATE Sunday March 15:
Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, schools will be closed starting tomorrow, Monday
March 16. Only staff should report to work tomorrow. If students need to pick up
materials from school such as books, musical instruments, medications they may do so
tomorrow. Elementary schools will be open 8 AM to 3 PM and Palombi will be open 7
AM to 2 PM. Buildings will not be open beginning Tuesday and they will remain closed
until April 3rd. More information about Chromebooks for students in KDG-2 grade,
online learning, and student lunches will be forthcoming. Please pay attention to your
email as well as the district website. Thank you.
text:

until April 3rd. More information about Chromebooks for students in KDG-2 grade,
online learning, and student lunches will be forthcoming. Please pay attention to your
email as well as the district website. Thank you.

post_text: Reminder - Community Meeting regarding the referendum that will be on the March 17th election ballot is tonight, March 2nd beginning at 7:00 p.m. in the Administrative Center located at Palombi Middle School.
text: Reminder - Community Meeting regarding the referendum that will be on the March 17th election ballot is tonight, March 2nd beginning at 7:00 p.m. in the Administrative Center located at Palombi Middle School.

post_text:
Please see below - this is correct statement regarding the upcoming referendum. The amount should be 19.3M less not 9.3M, we apologize for our error.

In December, the board unanimously approved a resolution for $30.7M referendum for the March 17th ballot. In a nutshell, the board and administration listened to the community and significant changes were made from our previous referendum attempt in April. This time we are asking 19.3M less because we eliminated Pleviak School improvements, 21st Century Learning along with other projects. Also, we will only be doing modest cafeteria projects at Hooper and Palombi. There will only be a single bond question on the ballot.
text:

This time we are asking 19.3M less because we eliminated Pleviak School improvements, 21st Century Learning along with other projects. Also, we will only be doing modest cafeteria projects at Hooper and Palombi. There will only be a single bond question on the ballot.

post_text:
Lake Villa School District will be seeking feedback from stakeholders for four different program change considerations. These include the addition of a four-year-old preschool program, reduction in class size for primary students to 18 or fewer students per section, and bringing back Self-Contained Autism and Life Skills Classes to the district that are currently held off-site. Any of these potential changes would require attaining additional classroom space at all of the district elementary schools. To create space, the district would need to move sixth grade students to the middle school.

Stakeholder presentations regarding these potential changes are scheduled for September 4th and 5th at Palombi Middle School from 6:00-7:00 pm. Additionally, a survey will be sent out to stakeholders to gain additional feedback on September 6th.

If you are unable to attend the presentations the district will be streaming it live on our district website at www.district41.org.
shared_text:
DISTRICT41.ORG
Lake Villa School District 41 / Homepage
text:
Lake Villa School District will be seeking feedback from stakeholders for four different program change considerations. These include the addition of a four-year-old preschool program, reduction in class size for primary students to 18 or fewer students per section, and bringing back Self-Contained Autism and Life Skills Classes to the district that are currently held off-site. Any of these potential changes would require attaining additional classroom space at all of the district elementary schools. To create space, the district would need to move sixth grade students to the middle school.

Stakeholder presentations regarding these potential changes are scheduled for September 4th and 5th at Palombi Middle School from 6:00-7:00 pm. Additionally, a survey will be sent out to stakeholders to gain additional feedback on September 6th.

If you are unable to attend the presentations the district will be streaming it live on our district website at www.district41.org.

post_text:
Lake Villa Community Consolidated School District #41 - Notice of Public Hearing

The Board of Education of Lake Villa Community Consolidated School District #41 will hold a Public Hearing Monday, August 19, 2019 at 7:00 pm in the boardroom of the Administration Center located at 131 McKinley Avenue, Lake Villa, Illinois. The purpose of said hearing will be to receive public comment on a proposed waiver to allow the district to waive the school holidays of Lincoln's Birthday, Casimir Pulaski's Birthday and Veteran's Day.

Alex Barbour Ed.D.
Assistant Superintendent of Teaching and Learning
Lake Villa Community Consolidated School District #41

post_text: Due to the extensive funeral procession for State Trooper Gerald Ellis, local roads will be closed and heavy traffic is expected tomorrow, Friday, April 5th. Because of the procession all District #41 schools will be dismissed on the half day schedule tomorrow and all Early Childhood and Preschool classes are cancelled. Palombi will be released at 10:40 a.m., Thompson and Martin Schools 11:15 a.m. and Hooper School at 11:45 a.m. Be advised this half day will not need to be made up in June.

post_text:
We are continuing to monitor the ice storm closely. Unfortunately, forecasts are varied and we don't know how much until early morning. A decision will be made by 5:15 am this means is we do not send out an alert schools will be open.

The temps are fluctuating between 31 and 33 degrees and just one degree can make a huge difference. Our concerns aren't just solely icy roads but working power lines HVAC heating conditions. Please bear with us and thank you for your understanding.
text:

post_text: Due to the predicted inclement weather conditions all District #41 schools will be closed tomorrow, Monday, January 28th and the Board of Education meeting is also cancelled.

post_text: Schools will be OPEN tomorrow. In fact, the majority, if not all schools throughout Lake County will remain open. Wind chill temperatures are expected to be -20 to -30 degrees below zero at daybreak. We will not have outdoor recess and parents should take extra caution if they have children waiting at bus stops or walking to school. Next week's weather looks very challenging with snow on the way Monday and even more extreme temperatures predicted for mid-week.

post_text: Dear Parents/Guardians, At approximately 2:00 p.m. today Lake Villa District 41 received a call from a concerned parent who communicated that they thought they heard a bomb threat was made to the school district. As of now, the district is not aware of any bomb threat to any district schools. As a precaution, the district has contacted the Lake Villa Police Chief, Craig Somerville. He indicated that "these types of threats are all coming through emails into spam accounts all over the county and in counties mainly targeting library's. We find nothing credible with it whatsoever". Our goal is, and will continue to provide a a safe and secure environment for our students and staff.

We find nothing credible with it whatsoever". Our goal is, and will continue to provide a a safe and secure environment for our students and staff.

post_text: We would like to provide everyone with an update for the three students who were transported to the hospital as a result of today's lightning strike near the corner of Lotus and Ottawa in Round Lake Heights . All three students are alert, communicative, and in stable condition.
text: We would like to provide everyone with an update for the three students who were transported to the hospital as a result of today's lightning strike near the corner of Lotus and Ottawa in Round Lake Heights . All three students are alert, communicative, and in stable condition.

post_text: There has been a lighting strike at the bus stop near the corner of Ottawa and Lotus in Round Lake Heights. Three students were taken to Condell Hospital. The rest of the students were transported to the school. Please continue to visit the district website www.district41.org and facebook for updates.

post_text:
9/14/18

Dear Parents/Guardians:

Early this morning, one of our parents shared a social media message with the Palombi Middle School Principal. This message, that was shared with their son, contained a threat to students. After further investigation, this threat was made by an out of state student at an out of state school. The Lake Villa Police Department were contacted immediately and they have been in contact with the police department where the threat originated. Lake Villa Students were not the target of this threat.

The school district would like to thank this parent for bringing this information to our attention so quickly. We encourage all parents and students to immediately contact the school district and local police department in the event that a threat is made that would jeopardize the safety of our school community. Our goal is to continue to do everything within our capability to ensure the safety of our students and staff.

Sincerely,

Dr. Alex Barbour
Assistant Superintendent of Teaching and Learning
Lake Villa School District #41

post_text: The soft lockdown has been lifted. District 41 has been in contact with Lake Villa Police Department. Although the situation is not resolved as of yet, it is contained, and there is no threat to any of our schools, staff, or students. As a result we will be lifting the soft lockdown. We are keeping students in for recess and PE for the remainder of the day. Thank you for your patience during this time. The safety of our students and staff is our number one priority. (12:25 p.m.)
text: The soft lockdown has been lifted. District 41 has been in contact with Lake Villa Police Department. Although the situation is not resolved as of yet, it is contained, and there is no threat to any of our schools, staff, or students. As a result we will be lifting the soft lockdown. We are keeping students in for recess and PE for the remainder of the day. Thank you for your patience during this time. The safety of our students and staff is our number one priority. (12:25 p.m.)

post_text: Due to an ongoing situation in Antioch, District #41 will be going on a soft lockdown this means no parents or guardians will be allowed to enter or leave the buildings and students will be kept in for gym and recess until further notice. Please continue to visit the district website and Facebook for updates. (10:20 a.m.)
text: Due to an ongoing situation in Antioch, District #41 will be going on a soft lockdown this means no parents or guardians will be allowed to enter or leave the buildings and students will be kept in for gym and recess until further notice.
